name: Dungeons
description: Assume the role of a mighty (and mighty evil) Dungeon Lord and create your own diabolical demesnes underground. 10 different classes of heroes dare to enter your dungeon where 15 different monsters lurk in the dark.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/Vista/ XP SP2 Processor: 2.0 GHz Dual Core Memory: 2 GB Graphics: 256 MB DirectX 9.0c Graphics card with Shader Model 3.0 Hard Drive: 2 GB free HDD Sound: Windows-compatible Soundcard

reviews.review_text: The idea is nice, but the implementation is not. The game creators compare it to Diabolo and Dungeon Keeper. I'm not the Diabolo fanboy, but Dungeon Keeper is a way better game that this one.   The good: visuals, some scenarios in campaign.  The average: gameplay, magic system, skill system, in-game jokes. The bad: controls, building system (there are a lots of build items which are essentially the same). The ugly: launching the game (you need to pass 3 screens to simply launch the game). The verdict: I'm not going to play this game ever again.
The more you play this the more you realize it's just not any fun. Sad game and I'm sad I spent 6 bucks on this damn thing instead of giving it to games that get the fun part right.

A challenging and rewarding game, Dungeons caught my interest initially as it seemed like it would be a modern and updated version of the classic Dungeon Keeper games. It is clearly inspired by them which can be seen by the many similarities, though this game shines on its own with its innovation. A must-have for any fan of playing as 'the bad guy' in a dungeon building game.

If you never rage-quit a game this one might be for you. The game itself is not hard but almost any mistake will cost you a level restart. Example: I setup a small dungeon in sandbox mode and opened my first gate, only to find that as opposed to spawning single hero it spawns parties of heroes. As a result my forces were quickly overwhelmed and I had to restart. Gate itself didn't have any marking to distinguish itself from other gates. This is just one example but I keep running into similar scenarios. Could be that it is my noobery but then again after giving this game couple of tries I feel like its just a waste of my time. Let me know if you had a different experience.

When I first got the game it worked great and I loved it, sure it was no dungeon keeper but it was solid and then the first update patch reared its ugly head and I've been unable to play it ever since, if they fixed it it might get a recommendation but since I've been waiting at least 3 years for a fix, I doubt it'll be happening

TL;DR: Dungeons is a game with an interesting concept, however once you get past the excitement of something different to your usual RTS... It just becomes repetitive. Don't buy at full price.  Dungeons is a game where rather than building up your lair, recruiting forces, and ultimately taking over the 'upper realm' by force, you instead aim to coax heroes into your dungeon, increase their happiness through them finding gold, fighting (and beating) your minions, finding weapons, and research. You then kill them to take back this happiness as soul power. The game starts off slowly as you try to become accustomed to this, but then accelerates into you having to manage all of these, as well as ensuring your main objectives are met, to prioritising spending on dungeon improvements or objectives. Which is all well and good, except it's the same formula, and as you get towards the end of the campaign, all you dungeon building is taken care of already.  I blitzed through the campaign and as it is an older game, did not try the multiplayer. Buy this game on sale for a bit of enjoyment, but don't expect to have your mind blown.
If you liked Dungeon Keeper don't buy this game.  Advertised as being similar to the old dungeon keeper, this is anything but. A glorified tower defense with real redeeming features.
complicate to understand, poor gfx, bad animations... is this game supposed to be fun to play in whatever scenario? thumb down, and no, this is NOT dungeon keeper.

Do not buy Kalypso Games. I am glad I am out only 15 dollars after buying this game for a firend and myself. Th activation servers have not worked and after going to their support page it is even worse. It seems this is normal for them where you cannot log into games or get the account created. An email to their support returned a canned response. No more Kalypso.
One of the few games I've purchased on Steam that I wish I could get my money back for. Advertised like the classic Dungeon Keeper, but play nothing like it.

NOT Dungeon Keeper. Not at ALL Dungeon Keeper. Despite what you may have seen or been led to belive this game is not related to Dungeon Keeper at all...except maybe roughly similar humor (though not as funny or effectivly delievered). However, what Dungeons is, is a Tychoon game, like railroad or rollercoaster or themepark tychoon. It's a humours game where you get to customize your dungeon keeper (you play the big boss basicly) and you build your dungeon in order to give heroes a 'good adventure' inside of it, once they are happy and fat and pleased with themselves you beat the hell out of them and throw them in prison, sucking their soul energy, witch lets you build and further upgrade your dungeon. It's been threw enough patches to where it runs fine now, and it's a decent game for a on sale price (i wouldn't pay fll though). As long as your not expecting it to be Dungeon Keeper 3 you might actually enjoy the game.
Its a good game. Simple, but has its moments of fun and funny.

fun game which i'd love to recommend without a 2nd though but the fact that the game still has known bugs (mostly minor but annoying esp if you are a compltionist as i often am) which dont seem to be adressed it annoying...  still, fun game - buy it on sale!

Really underrated.  It feels almost like a tycoon game at times, creating the perfect dungeon arrangement that satisfies all heroes, at a set distance to your dungeon, at a set HP remaining so they're not an actual challenge to slay. The only two downsides are Champions are really boring and I would have liked to see them have more personality, abilities, or effect on the game itself. The other is that the campaign bosses are a complete joke and they tried too hard to make scripted experiences - I would have loved to see that effort put elsewhere into another mechanic or feature.  If this game didn't have Dungeons in the name, it probably wouldn't have gotten so much crap for not being a clone of Dungeon Keeper. It can stand on its own!

After an hour playing this game I still have absolutely no idea of how you are supposed to play it. It looks fun enough but its extremely confusing for a first timer and I simply don't have the time to devote to reading how to guides on how to play a game.   Seems far too over the top and convoluted to me but that is my personal opinion. I am only recommending it because it looks like a lot of fun but it's quite the learning curve.
This game sucks ♥♥♥♥ for cocaine.  I recommend it if you do also.  This game was marketed as Dunegon Keeper 3 and it does not deliver.

I won't complain that this game isn't Dungeon Keeper. No matter how much I really want it to be War For The Overworld.  This game is, however, more like what would happen if someone decided to try and mix Dota 2 and Dungeon Keeper. You have a physical pressence in the game you have to manually direct to attack, activate things and generally progress. While games like Baldurs Gate may spring to mind. this does not have much in the way of combat other than 'go attack that person... right, they died...'. There is no customisation of your 'keeper' further than leveling up to gain spells with real-time cool-downs... This might be better likened to Overlord, but without the cusomisation of your weapons... or the thrilling gameplay.  I don't like games that have me watching for seconds, checking my mana, waiting for a specific moment between the slow, repeating combat animations and then unleashing some spell that i'm going to have to wait another 00:40 to use again. This is not Warcraft!  The game quickly gets pissy and overly picky about what you need to do. The dynamic of 'let heroes in and let them get real happy to farm their souls' comes off as a little strange at best. Let them walk in, slay your creatures, then plunder the convenient piles of gold lay around? oh... kaay? kill them on their way out so you don't lose the gold and do gain their souls. Right? Ok, let's do that while trying to dig out some more rooms of your dungeon, expand your area of influence with pentagrams that summon enemies and need population points to build and build some decorations to give yourself prestiege. Don't forget to complete the challenges on each level to level up your guy to get better combat spells and that... did I forget to mention if you take too long, the next b*gger comes in and starts plundering somewhere else? Oh, and you're being attacked by someone else on the other side of your dungeon, better get back there. Better still, teleport somewhere even further away if you want to get there faster! uuh... no!  There is too much fiddly, useless and over-complicated systems. I can't compare this to dungeon keeper. that would be an insult to both games. This has multiple 'currencies' to constantly keep an eye on as you're building. Lacking tutorials that leave you not entirely sure what you're supposed to be doing and, I hate to be mean, but if you're playing a game about managing a dungeon, i don't need to tell myself to walk over here so the hero doesn't see me before i kill him... honestly, it does not seem very well thought out.  I would love to change my review, but this is too under-developed to be an MMO, far too far away from being simple enough to play casually and, to be frank, no fun.
This game kills time but was not for me. The game takes a different approach to things as well as perspective. I have been playing games for about 20 years +. 5/10 (no game is perfect).
A frustratingly poor Dungeon Keeper ripoff, I recommend you save your money.
It's bad, to be bad.
Although it is rated 65/100 I really enjoy this game.
The concept of the game is very interesting to me. The actual gameplay wasn't anything spectacular though. The jokes were a little silly and I found myself zoning out during alot of the time.

We all know that look hungry adventurer's get in their eye at the sight of heaps of treasure, mystical artifacts or horrid monsters to vanquish. Most of us have been that hero before. But what about the gleam in the eye of the Dungeon Lord as he watches his victims stroll through his lair, unaware of their impending fate as they gobble up all the goodies left strategically about to only lure them into his dungeon? Well this game lets you find out exactly what that is like. Based off the classic Dungeon Keeper games, this RTS/Tycoon game puts you in-charge of your very own Dungeon, allowing you to build hundreds of rooms and corridors, decor them with items to bait curious adventurers, and create many traps and monsters to ultimately finish them off! The goal: make your dungeon interesting enough to please adventurers til they are content, thus fulfilling their wishes and maxing their soul energy, and then killing/capturing them before they escape. Tons of fun, a must-have!

This game is kinda fun to begin with, but it unfortuanetly never does something new after the first few levels. After that, it's the same over and over again, with the occasional skin change. I feel this game needed more RTS style gameplay, too much is autopilot, the only thing you really do is build stuff, and too many items are the same thing with a new paintjob. I can actually kinda compare this game to the Sims, which is not good when you are catering to a complelty different audience :/.  All in all, it's an okay game, but there is better things to spend your money on.
This game is ♥♥♥♥ compared to dungeon keeper.

I imagined something like Sim theme park sort of thing when buying this (more in depth of course), but the game is buggy, sluggish and overall repetitive and un-interesting. If you absolutely die for a dungeon crafting sim then go ahead, but anyone else looking for a fun simulator can skip this.
Kinda fun playing the bad guy!
This game has not been gripping. Runs slowly and moves slowly. As far as the gameplay has been concerned it had too much time wasted with in game ratings vs. early playtime.

Tried so hard to get into this game. Just couldn't. Big fan of DK which this game is not. It has some nice features, but badly designed. The tutorial missions are completely unclear on how to use the features and accomplish the goals. The interface is difficult to use and the game is just not clear how to play it. It's more frustrating than anything else.
Gets very boring very quickly.
